dublinCore.dc:title: 115 HR 2932 IH: Foreign Investment and Economic Security Act of 2017
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

action.action-desc: Ms. DeLauro (for herself, Mr. Conyers, Mr. DeFazio, Mr. Grijalva, Mr. Pocan, and Ms. Slaughter) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Financial Services, and in addition to the Committees on Foreign Affairs, and Energy and Commerce, for a period to be subsequently determined by the Speaker, in each case for consideration of such provisions as fall within the jurisdiction of the committee concerned

form.official-title: To amend the Defense Production Act of 1950 to provide for a net benefit review of certain covered transactions, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Foreign Investment and Economic Security Act of 2017.
Section 721(a)(3) of the Defense Production Act of 1950 (50 U.S.C. App. 2170(a)(3)) is amended—

paragraph.text: by striking means any merger and inserting the following:

subparagraph.text: any merger

paragraph.text: by striking the period and inserting ; and; and
by adding at the end the following:

subparagraph.text: any construction of a new facility in the United States by any foreign person.

subsection.text: Section 721 of the Defense Production Act of 1950 (50 U.S.C. App. 2170) is amended—

subparagraph.text: in the heading for such subsection, by inserting and net benefit after National Security;
in paragraph (1)—

clause.text: in the heading for such paragraph, by inserting and net benefit after National security;
in subparagraph (A), by striking clauses (i) and (ii) and inserting the following:

subclause.text: review the covered transaction to determine the effects of the transaction on the national security of the United States; and
consider the factors specified in subsection (f) for such purpose, as appropriate; and

clause.text: shall review the covered transaction to determine whether such transaction is of net benefit to the United States, as provided under subsection (o).
by adding at the end the following:

subparagraph.header: Mandatory net benefit review for certain covered transactions
subparagraph.text: The President and the Committee shall initiate a net benefit review of a covered transaction under subparagraph (A)(ii) if such transaction meets the requirements of paragraphs (1) and (2) of section 7A(a) of the Clayton Act (15 U.S.C. 18a(a)).
in paragraph (3)(A), by inserting national security before review each place it appears in the heading and text of such subparagraph; and

paragraph.text: by adding at the end the following:
For purposes of carrying out the net benefit determination under subsection (b)(1)(A)(ii), the President, acting through the Committee, shall consider—

subparagraph.text: the effect on the level of economic activity in the United States on—

clause.text: the level and quality of employment;
the utilization of parts and services produced in the United States;
the utilization of products, parts, and services imported into the United States; and

subparagraph.text: the effect of the proposed or pending transaction on productivity, industrial efficiency, technological development, technology transfers, and product innovation in the United States;
the effect of the proposed or pending transaction on competition within any industry in the United States or between the United States and other countries;
the compatibility of the proposed or pending transaction with national industrial and economic policies;
the effect on the public health, safety, the environment, and well-being of United States consumers;
in the case of a covered transaction that is a foreign government-influenced transaction—

clause.text: the governance and commercial orientation of the foreign person engaging in such transaction;

how and the extent to which the foreign person engaging in such transaction is owned or controlled by a foreign government or its conduct and operations are influenced by a foreign government, including considering the stated government policies of the country of origin of the foreign person regarding government support or policies relating to the economic sector involved in such transaction;
whether the foreign person engaging in such transaction—

subclause.text: adheres to United States standards of corporate governance (including commitments to transparency and disclosure, independent members of the board of directors, independent audit committees, and equitable treatment of shareholders);
adheres to United States laws and practices; and

is a foreign person of a country whose government has adequately engaged with the Securities and Exchange Commission and the Public Company Accounting Oversight Board in order to promote and ensure adequate transparency; and

clause.text: whether the foreign person engaging in such transaction will likely operate on a commercial basis if such transaction is completed, including with regard to—

subclause.text: the participation of United States citizens in its operations in the United States and elsewhere;
the impact of the investment on productivity and industrial efficiency in the United States;
support of on-going innovation, research, and development in the United States;
the appropriate level of capital expenditures to maintain the United States business in a globally competitive position; and

subparagraph.text: such other factors as the Committee determines appropriate.

paragraph.text: In making a net benefit determination under subsection (b)(1)(A)(ii)—

subparagraph.text: judgments will be made both in measuring the effects of a proposed or pending transaction in relation to the relevant individual factors under paragraph (1) and in measuring the aggregate net effect after offsetting the negative effects, if any, against the positive ones; and
a proposed or pending transaction will be determined to be of net benefit to the United States when the aggregate net effect is positive, regardless of its extent over the short- and long-term.

If the Committee makes a determination that the covered transaction will not be of net benefit to the United States, the parties to the covered transaction may, within the 30-day period following such determination, submit additional information to the Committee to demonstrate that the transaction will be of net benefit to the United States.
The Committee shall—

clause.text: make a final determination of whether the covered transaction will be of net benefit to the United States before the end of the 30-day period beginning on the date that additional information is submitted pursuant to subparagraph (A); and
if such determination is that the covered transaction will not be of net benefit to the United States, refer such determination to the President.

paragraph.text: Notwithstanding subsection (b)(3), upon a final determination by the Committee under this subsection, the chairperson and the head of the lead agency shall make certifications to the Congress on the net benefit determination that are as close as practicable to the certifications required under subsection (b)(3) for the national security review.

paragraph.header: Action by President after net benefit review

subparagraph.text: If the Committee refers a determination to the President pursuant to paragraph (3)(ii), the President shall, within the 15-day period beginning on the date of such referral, review such determination and announce whether the President determines the covered transaction is of net benefit to the United States.
For purposes of making a determination under subparagraph (A), the President shall consider, among other factors each of the factors described in paragraph (1), as appropriate.
If the President, pursuant to subparagraph (A), determines that a covered transaction is not of net benefit to the United States, such covered transaction is prohibited.

The President shall direct the Attorney General of the United States to seek appropriate relief, including divestment relief, in the district courts of the United States, in order to implement and enforce this paragraph.
A determination of the President under this paragraph shall not be subject to judicial review.

paragraph.header: Committee membership for purposes of a net benefit determination
paragraph.text: For purposes of carrying out the net benefit determination under subsection (b)(1)(A)(ii) and this subsection, the Committee shall be composed of the following members or the designee of any such member:

subparagraph.text: The Attorney General of the United States.
The Secretary of Commerce.
The Secretary of Labor.
The Secretary of the Treasury.
The United States Trade Representative.
The Secretary of Energy.
The Secretary of Transportation.
If the President determines that the covered transaction may affect the agricultural sector, including food safety, the Secretary of Agriculture.
If the President determines that the covered transaction may affect the public health, including food safety, the Secretary of Health and Human Services.

paragraph.text: For purposes of this subsection, the term foreign government-influenced transaction means any covered transaction where the foreign person engaging in such transaction is owned, controlled, or influenced, directly or indirectly, by a foreign government.

subsection.text: Not later than the end of the 180-day period beginning on the date of the enactment of this Act, the President shall issue regulations to carry out section 721(o) of the Defense Production Act of 1950, as added by subsection (a).

section.text: Section 721(a) of the Defense Production Act of 1950 (50 U.S.C. App. 2170(a)) is amended—

subparagraph.text: by striking by a foreign government and inserting the following:
a foreign government
by striking the period and inserting ; or; and
by adding at the end the following:
a person with access, directly or indirectly, to below-market loans or other financing from a foreign government.
by striking virtual, so vital and inserting the following:
so vital
by striking the period and inserting ; or; and
by adding at the end the following:

in a critical infrastructure sector, as determined by the Secretary of Homeland Security pursuant to the Presidential Policy Director titled Presidential Policy Directive—Critical Infrastructure Security and Resilience (Feb. 12, 2013).
